intro: Lachenalia physocaulos, commonly known as the bulbous lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, underground bulbs that store water and nutrients. The plant produces clusters of narrow, grass-like leaves and bears showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
